title: The Story of My Life, volumes 4-6
author: Hare, Augustus J. C. (Augustus John Cuthbert)

title: The Story of My Life, volumes 4-6

title: The captain of the guard.
author: Grant, James
snippet: to wit, the Lairds of Glendoning, Strabrock, Pompherston, Pittendreicli, Douglasburn, Cairnglas, Braidwood, and Glenbervie, all liorsed and armed alike, the sole difference being the heraldic cadence of descent on their splendidly- embroidered jupons and horse-trappings, bore on the points of their lances a canopy of blue silk tasselled and fringed with silver.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: Sir James Douglas, of Glenbervie, took Brodick Castle,and massacred the English soldiery, and Sir Robert Boydleft King Edward I.'s service on the approach of spring, andpassed over to the isle of Arran, where they were joined byBruce, who sailed over from Rathlin with a fleet of thirtythree small ships (boats), February, 1306.

title: Early Travellers in Scotland. Edited by P. Hume Brown. [With maps.]
author: Brown, Peter Hume.
